intro: Trichotosia gowana, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its strap-like leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and subalpine regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its fibrous leaves have been traditionally used by Māori for making baskets and other crafts. Trichotosia gowana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to local biodiversity.
